text: So, my co-worker just came upon a pretty cool way to setup multistep forms
No need to have a HubSpot form hidden on the page to write your own markup

Worth being aware that this creates a disconnect between the Form in HubSpot and the Form on the site, so you'd need to do your own validation, ensure the options are the same, collect the hs cookies etc. We're super aware of the need for multistep forms, it's on our radar :+1:
<@U24DCSJBE> He literally just stumbled across this about an hour ago.  Anything else major we should look for going this route?
specifically trying to figure out how to include all `hs_context` values in the action url

Theres a little more info on how to build the `hs_context` value available here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form> The only other important thing to keep in mind is that the form itself on the site needs to be manually maintained. So if you had a dropdown in HS, and you added a value, you'd need to be sure to update the corresponding dropdown on your form to make sure the right options are available

So i'm scratching my head trying to figure out how someone in the forum is doing their topics: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Creating-listing-page-by-topic/m-p/187379#M5761>

Their URL they shared shows as `/press/tag/ohio` instead of `press/topics/ohio` I am guessing they did the url manager to accomplish this but I am not sure any ideas how they did this?
can we change the name of our `topics` to be something else like tags?

Posted this in <#C960Q64G4|design-manager> but trying here: Seems that *export_to_template_context* doesn't work for blog posts in DM2. Trying to bring a custom property over into the listing view and it doesn't seem to be coming across. Ideas?
Dumb question that really isnt meant for here, but does anyone know how to get to the Content Settings via the new HubSpot Navigation? I cant find it anywhere
There should be a cog button next to the search icon
on the top right
content settings has merged with the rest of settings
Ah i see now, thanks!
So how do portals get the new menu? I dont see it in any of my portals...
It is being rolled out over the course of the next couple days <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/nav-change-2018>
is something wrong with advanced menus?

has anyone worked with different redirect pages from a form submission, based on the user’s inputted data? A client is having me look at current code they have, where this is being done via a window.location change in the onFormSubmit callback. the analytics between the form submissions and the page views on the redirect pages isn’t matching up, even when filtering out for unique pageviews in GA. My thought is that the onFormSubmit happens post-validation/pre-sending of data, so there’s a race condition between the browser changing and the request getting sent off.

Anyone worked with us, or can confirm that the existing code structure would lead to problems? Or any other ideas on implementation to solve it? We have some other API-intensive stuff we’ve built for them and they’re a fairly high-traffic site so I’m hesitating to make this an API-driven form, though we could run numbers on their request usage if we decide to go that route.
